intro: Lipochaeta micrantha var. micrantha, commonly known as small-flowered lipochaeta, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Goodeniaceae and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that typically range in color from pink to purple. The plant has hairy stems and leaves that are often narrow and lance-shaped. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and heathlands. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it requires well-drained soil and full sun.
